hostNotes.text: Welcome. I am X and today we will practice compassion for others for around 10 minutes. We’ll be doing an audio exercise, followed by time for reflection and finally sharing with each other – if we're up for it.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start? > Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one. Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.
Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. > Tap play to start the audio exercise

Now we’ll take 1 minutes to reflect on our own. How was that experience for you? How can you cultivate compassion in your personal life, what challenges do you anticipate in extending compassion to others? How can we extend the compassion we engage in within this our family and extend to our community?”

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now. > Press play to start the timer. That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing

1. \*\*What is said in here, stays in here.\*\* 

2. \*\*All you need to do is listen.\*\* There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. \*\*Everything on the inside is okay.\*\* Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is. There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.
Who would like to start? > Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing. Thank you so much, everyone.

content.text: How can you cultivate compassion in your personal life, what challenges do you anticipate in extending compassion to others?
How can we extend the compassion we engage in within this our family and extend to our community?”

hostNotes.text: Good job. Today, we’ve explored and practiced compassion for others.

By practising and cultivating compassion for others we begin to understand others’ feelings and reactions in relation to the situations in which they occur, and understand that, like oneself, others have feelings caused by needs.

Who would like to start? > Let everyone in the session check out one by one. Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today. > Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text:
If you’re up for it, you can continue with this mission.

Spend time reflecting on compassion for others how you could embody this day to day starting with small intentions and actions.
content.heading: Well done

en.name: Compassion for Others

hostNotes.text: > Press play to start the audio exercise

en.description: Compassion depends on awareness of the other’s situation and an ability to empathize with them, combined with a sense of affection or endearment towards that person, at even the most basic level of human connection. Compassion goes deeper than just external actions and also refers to a state of mind and heart: one’s intention to bring help and happiness to another person.

Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.
